p.value: This collection was donated to the University Archives by Ruth Wittenberg through Aileen Shaw in 1988.
The files are grouped into three series: I, Washington Square Park rehabilitation project; II, Related material; III, Related publications.

Ruth Wittenberg, a long-standing community activist, served on a number of civic organizations concerned with the refurbishing and rehabilitation of Washington Square Park between the years 1964 and 1972. She served as the Vice Chairman of Community Planning Board #2 and as Secretary of the Architects Committee assigned to the rehabilitation of the Park. She also served as reporter of the joint meetings of the Planning Board and Architects Committee.

physdesc.value: 1 Linear Feet in 2 manuscript boxes

abstract.value: Ruth Wittenberg, a long-standing community activist, served on a number of civic organizations associated with the Washington Square neighborhood. These papers concern Washington Square Park and primarily date from the 1960s and 1970s, when the park was renovated.

physloc.value: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

unittitle.value: WSRP-Minutes and Planning Board #2 and Architecture Committees
Wittenberg article: "Washington Square Park: An Important Landmark"
Series I. Washington Square Rehabilitation Project

p.value: Material in Series I relates primarily to the involvement of the Planning Board and Architects Committee in the rehabilitation of Washington Square Park.

unittitle.value: Washington Square Association Minutes and Proposals

p.value: Series II contains documents of park-affiliated organizations, including the Washington Square Association and the Washington Square Playground Council.

Series III contains original and photocopied newspaper clippings of park rehabilitation developments, as well as a glimpse of community concerns regarding the park's physical and social evolution between 1962 and 1972.
Identification of item, date (if known); Ruth Wittenberg Papers; MC 95; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Materials were placed in acid-free folders and boxes.

The collection contains materials pertaining to citizen and local agency planning, development, and rehabilitation of Washington Square Park during the 1960s and 1970s. Document types include committee minutes, correspondence, designs, press releases, clippings, and background articles.

Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu
